text: <!everyone> looks like the slots are for may 3 and 5th. It's up on noodle now. Slots are disappearing let's pick one fast. Wednesday works any time between 1 and 6 for me, Friday I can only do the ones between 9am and 10am

<@U462P0B1R> the part of the script you wrote, I said originally it was timing out the worker so we needed to rethink it. I found and changed the timeout for workers so a really long analysis is better than a memory intensive one now
Should we do Friday so we have an extra day? There are 2 slots left after 10 (which I think Ken prefers)
I would be able to meet Wednesday from 10 until 2 and 4:15 onward. For Friday I can meet 10 until 2.
I'd have to skip a class on Friday to do 10, but I guess that's okay
It's the last class of the semester, probably won't matter much
If we reeeeeally need to, I could skip my Discrete review session. It goes from 9 to 10 in the morning.
Oooor we could do wednesday
Yeh if Friday is bad we can just do Wednesday. I have to do an expo Wednesday and would prefer 4pm
I'd rather not skip the class on friday
4pm works for me
Okay well now we just have to wait for luke
Agreed. Let's do Wednesday then. My only issue is I have interview grading for Computer Systems until 4:06 on Wednesday. There seem to be plenty of options after that though!
Yeh that one
That works!
Let's book it now, if Luke can't make that time we'll have to find another but let's nab it while we can
Okay I booked it, may 3rd 4:36-4:46 it is
yea cant do friday
unless its before 10
thats good
u push the heroku code?
So Wednesday at 4:36 works for you <@U462P0B1R> ?
yea
Cool
dont want to do a later date?
get last minute touches or anything?
Like Friday?
Wednesday and Friday are the only options
wed
I can do it at 7 Wednesday

okay so it's not our fault. I didn't think our puny little script was taking up halve a gig. It's actually redis-to-go, the server handling the workers. The nano (free) plan only offers 5mb of memory >_<
I'll try to look for alternatives I guess
heroku redis, which isn't as hand holdy as redistogo, gives 25mb of memory. 5 times as much may help
all fixed, noun dict and user dict don't go over memory any more. I'm gonna test to see how far 25mbs can get us on the search
Okay I got it working! Foundit can handle pretty much anything you'd reasonably want to search, just tested 100 posts, 20 on all the fields and it worked fine :slightly_smiling_face:
